dict.acceptation: 惊讶：突然或出乎意料地面对；突击，逮捕；使感到惊讶；惊讶地发现；
惊讶，惊奇；使惊讶的事物；

sent.orig: If the sheer numbers surprised me, the men themselves surprised me even more.
sent.trans: 如果说纯粹的数字已让我感到惊讶，这些男人本身就更加出乎我的意料。

sent.orig: Therefore, I was also surprised seeing them and they were even more surprised than me.
sent.trans: 所以，那天碰到她们我很惊讶，不过她们好像比我更惊讶。

sent.orig: I'd be surprised if Kevin Rudd was the source of the leak, I'd be very surprised.
sent.trans: 我感到惊讶，如果陆克文是该泄漏源，我会非常惊讶。

sent.orig: I'm surprised at this information. He was surprised at the answer to this question.
sent.trans: 我对这条信息感到吃惊。他对这个问题的答案感到吃惊。

sent.orig: You will be surprised at how fast the paper is used up.
sent.trans: 你会对纸用如此之快感到吃惊。
